_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OUR COMPANY IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN GRAIN STORAGE FOR AREA PRODUCERS AS WELL AS PROVIDING THE NECESSARY INPUTS FOR GRAIN PRODUCTION.   THIS COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE.  OUR OWNERS, MANAGERS AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.



OUR PLANT CONSIST OF ONE 30,000 AND ONE 26,000 GALLON ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE TANKS AND WHEN FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY WILL HOLD APPROXIMATELY 246,000 POUNDS.  WITH THE ADDITION OF 40 NURSE TANKS WITH A CAPACITY OF 176,000 POUNDS MAKES THE COMPANYA?S TOTAL CAPACITY OF 422,000 POUNDS.



 THE WORST CASE AND THE ALTERNATE RELEASE SCENARIOS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED AND SHARED WITH OUR LOCAL FIRST RESPONDERS AS PART OF AN ON-GOING TRAINING PROGRAM.  MORE IMPORTANTLY, OUR EMPLOYEES HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE EMERGENCY ACTIONS, INCLUDING THE EMERGENCY MEETING PLACE AND EACH OF THEIR INDIVIDUAL RESPONSIBILITIES REGARDING AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.



THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR NH3 PLANT IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT.  CHANGES OR IMPROVEMENTS IN THE FACILITYA?S EQUIPMENT WILL BE ACTED UPON IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING THE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY (KDAA?S) REQUEST, OR AS FOUND TO BE NECESSARY BY OUR MAINTENANCE STAFF.



OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, SITE SPECIFIC OPERATING PROCEDURES, PLANT MAINTENANCE AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL.  EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF EMERGENCY SAFETY WATER DURING NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS. 



WITH THE ABOVE-MENTIONED TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY EASY TO REPORT THAT ABSOLUTELY NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS.  ONE REL

EASE THAT DID REQUIRE A NOTIFICATION IN 2009 WAS THE RESULT OF A THEFT OF PRODUCT AT THIS LOCATION.



OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RISKS TO EMPLOYEES, THE SURROUNDING PUBLIC AND THE AREA FIRST RESPONDERS.  THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR ACTION PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE COUNTY LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMISSION (LEPC).  EACH OF OUR RESPONDING AGENCIES ARE AWARE OF THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY OR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE.



MANAGEMENT OF THIS COMPANY AND FACILITY CONTINUOUSLY LOOK FOR WAYS TO ENHANCE THE SAFETY OF THIS LOCATION.  QUARTERLY SAFETY INSPECTIONS ARE CONDUCTED WHICH RESULT IN CORRECTIVE ACTIONS:  ANNUAL EQUIPMENT INSPECTIONS ARE ALSO CONDUCTED, AND DETAILED ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND SAFETY AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED AT LEAST EVERY THREE YEARS.
